course_overview: This comprehensive course provides a structured foundation in Python programming for novices. Starting with installation and basic syntax, learners progress through variables, data types, control structures, functions, and file handling. Real-world projects include building calculators, text analyzers, and simple automation scripts. The curriculum emphasizes readable code, debugging skills, and computational thinking while introducing object-oriented programming concepts. Final modules cover error handling and preparing for advanced Python paths like data analysis or web development.
target_audience: Absolute beginners with no prior coding experience, including students, career switchers, and professionals seeking automation skills for office tasks.
learning_outcomes: Write executable Python scripts using variables, operators, and data types
Implement conditional logic and iterative loops to solve computational problems
Create and manipulate core data structures including lists, dictionaries, and tuples
Develop modular programs through custom function definition and parameter handling
Read from and write to text files for data persistence operations
Apply debugging techniques to identify and resolve common syntax and logic errors
